intro: Gymnanthemum grande, commonly known as the large-flowered gymnanthemum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Gymnanthemum grande is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream sides.
